formattedAddress: 1320 York Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1320 York Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA

editorialSummary.text: Counter-serve chain for ready-made sandwiches plus breakfast, coffee, soups & salads.

originalText.text: I have been going to Pret for 2.5years and normally really like it but found a piece of cardboard in my soup recently so I don’t think I can go back any time soon…

text.text: I have been going to Pret for 2.5years and normally really like it but found a piece of cardboard in my soup recently so I don’t think I can go back any time soon…

originalText.text: Throughout our time through Europe and America, this was the one reoccurring cafe that we used as our base for good food. Nutritious and easy, perhaps if they opened branches in Australia would they be popular, though I know that I’d be going there all the time. Definitely the handiest food option and healthiest. The atmosphere is wholesome and the insides always spacious and bright. Many, many selections available for everyone. Great place.

text.text: Throughout our time through Europe and America, this was the one reoccurring cafe that we used as our base for good food. The atmosphere is wholesome and the insides always spacious and bright. Many, many selections available for everyone. Great place.

originalText.text: Thought staff could have better customer service. Manager & staff could use better training on hospitality. Food was fine and tasted as good as other locations.

text.text: Thought staff could have better customer service. Manager & staff could use better training on hospitality. Food was fine and tasted as good as other locations.

originalText.text: This Pret location always looks the same as the pics I shared below. They never have half sandwiches or a full stock of any sandwich for that matter. As you can see there is one of each of everything on the shelves leaving you with very minimal options. They are promoting the return of the Lobster roll but don’t have any today. What a surprise.. I never left a review before but this is ridiculous and makes the company look bad. I’ve eaten at many prey locations and have never experienced what I do here on the upper East side. Being that we are near many hospitals and medical facilities I would think they have plenty of food to offer.. not my fav

originalText.text: Very rude staff. I asked for an "iced regular chai latte". Iced referring the temperature, and regular referring the size as indicated on the menu. They served up a hot chai latte. Mistakes happen but when I asked if they could pour it on ice, the lady got really rude and basically yelled “you asked for regular”. I clarified regular was the size, since the menu lists "regular" as the size. She then just handed me a cup of ice for me to take my latte elsewhere and pour it over the ice. I asked her if they could pour it since they have a counter and a sink, so I don’t spill this hot latte everywhere and she said “you can do it”. It turned into a debate just to have them use their sink and pour my latte on ice. Don’t come here, the sant ambroeus across the street is much nicer. My mom told me she's also had bad experiences with the cashier and stopped coming.
